predicate.note: Frames file for 'snag' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry.

example.name: quasi-agentive
example.text: The employees also said the project may have been snagged *trace* by budgetary concerns.

example.name: locative instrument
example.text: But the effort became snagged *trace* on the question of what would become of other issues, ranging from cutting the capital-gains tax to child care to repeal of catastrophic-illness insurance.
example.arg: the question of what would become of other issues, ranging from cutting the capital-gains tax to child care to repeal of catastrophic-illness insurance

example.name: different kind of instrument
example.text: The deficit-reduction bill became snagged over efforts to streamline the House version of the legislation in advance of a House-Senate conference.
example.arg: efforts to streamline the House version of the legislation in advance of a House-Senate conference

example.name: more obviously capture
example.text: John snagged the frisbee out of mid-air with his teeth.
